books.title: Poetry
books.author: Langston Hughes
books.summary: A collection of poems by Langston Hughes.

books.title: Tarzan of the Apes
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: An orphan is raised by apes in Africa and goes on various adventures.

books.title: Confessions of an English Opium-Eater
books.author: Thomas De Quincey
books.summary: A portrait of the life of a drug addict in Georgian-era London.

books.title: Tombstone
books.author: Walter Noble Burns
books.summary: An embellished retelling of the town of Tombstone, Arizona, during its heyday in the late 19th century, featuring famous heroes and outlaws of the American Old West.

books.title: Cornelli
books.author: Johanna Spyri
books.summary: A young girl’s emotional hurt requires time and love to heal.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of P. G. Wodehouse’s short fiction.

books.title: The Merchant of Venice
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: To help his friend Bassanio woo the beautiful Portia, the Venetian merchant Antonio borrows a large sum from Shylock, a Jewish moneylender.

books.title: The Shaving of Shagpat
books.author: George Meredith
books.summary: A Persian barber embarks on a quest to save a city from the clutches of a tyrant and his magical hair.

books.title: Dodsworth
books.author: Sinclair Lewis
books.summary: A newly-retired businessman’s peaceful European trip falls apart as his wife chases high European society.

books.title: The Return
books.author: Walter de la Mare
books.summary: After visiting a graveyard, a man finds his appearance has mysteriously changed.

books.title: The Mirror of the Sea
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: An autobiographical memoir on Joseph Conrad’s maritime experiences and his relationship with the sea.

books.title: File No. 113
books.author: Émile Gaboriau
books.summary: A bank is robbed and only two men appear to have the means to have done it; Monsieur Lecoq must discern if it was one of them or an “impossible” third party.

books.title: The Federalist Papers
books.author: Alexander Hamilton
books.summary: Eighty-five articles written by a group of U.S. Founding Fathers on why the proposed U.S. Constitution should be approved.

books.title: Heretics
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: A collection of essays in which G. K. Chesterton debates the intellectuals of his day on a range of topics.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Voltairine de Cleyre
books.summary: A collection of Voltairine de Cleyre’s poetry.

books.title: Penguin Island
books.author: Anatole France
books.summary: A myopic saint mistakenly baptizes some penguins, ushering in a centuries-spanning satire of French history.

books.title: Triplanetary
books.author: E. E. Smith
books.summary: In a universe where all powerful alien races influence the fates of worlds, a war erupts between the Triplanetary League of the inner solar system, pirates led by a mysterious and malicious scientist, and technologically advanced aliens.

books.title: The Confessions of Arsène Lupin
books.author: Maurice Leblanc
books.summary: The gentleman-thief relates stories of his outwitting the Parisian detectives.

books.title: An Inquiry Into the Accordancy of War with the Principles of Christianity
books.author: Jonathan Dymond
books.summary: Dymond argues that war is incompatible with the teachings of Christianity.

books.title: Letters Written During a Short Residence in Sweden, Norway, and Denmark
books.author: Mary Wollstonecraft
books.summary: Mary Wollstonecraft’s account of her travels through Scandinavia.
